about:
I'm César Hernández and graphics programmer. 

 	I'm enthusiastic of computer graphics, I like to develop technical demos to experiment with different tecniques of rendering.

portfolio.name: Basics Shading
portfolio.desc: Basics techniques of shading. From left to right: + Gouraud Shading. + Phong Shading. + Blinn Phong Shading.

portfolio.name: Difusse Shading
portfolio.desc:
Implementation of diffuse shading for materials. From left to right:
+ Lambert.
+ Oren-Nayar.

portfolio.name: Cook Torrance Shading Model
portfolio.desc: Cook Torrance shading model and planar reflectionswith stencil buffer.

portfolio.name: In-Hero
portfolio.desc: It’s a bullet hell game where the player controls a spaceship and have to destroy the enemies to can advance. Developed with Unity.

portfolio.name: Lab Madness
portfolio.desc: A dungeon crawler game. A crazy scientist lose the control of his laboratory and in order to recover it the player must eliminate the enemies and solve the puzzles. Developed in Unreal Engine 4.

portfolio.name: Super Minigolf
portfolio.desc: In this minigolf’s videogame the shots and bounces follow physics effects. The player has to complete every circuit to recover the control of the center of minigolf in the town that was kidnapped by some kind of monsters. Developed in Unity.

portfolio.name: Jagos
portfolio.desc: In a post-apocalyptic future where the human being was exterminated artificial intelligences fight for the territory. The player controls an AI named Jagos and must eliminates completely the others.

portfolio.name: Galaxian Ophtalmologic
portfolio.desc: It’s a serious game. Developed for students of Instituto Politécnico Nacional. The game was used as a complementary execirse to recover the sight. Developed with the Dog Game Engine OpenGL 4.0 version.

portfolio.name: Asteroids
portfolio.desc: Clone of classic Asteroid’s game. Developed with C/C++ and OpenGL.

portfolio.name: Arkanoid
portfolio.desc: Clone of classic Arkanoid’s game. Developed with C/C++ and OpenGL.

portfolio.name: Sabotage
portfolio.desc: It’s a clone of Sabotage’s game of 1982 of Mark Allen for the Apple II. It conserves the essence of the original game. Developed with GTG Engine and Java.
